page.title: 03Ouse River Walk : Skelton
page.content: We walked by the river and could see Clifton Hospital and the Shipton Road to the west and Poppleton over the river to the east. As we walked towards Skelton we saw on our right the new York Outer Ring Road being built. It ended very suddenly and we could see how it was being built up to form a ramp to the bridge which is to be built next year. We saw road making machinery on the new road and the hard-core stones underneath it. There is a flood-gate to the Ings at Skelton and the footpath goes through trees on the river bank. We saw a wren and lots of other birds in the trees and could small chemicals from the farmer's fields. The river bank curves round towards Nether Poppleton and the footpath goes on to Linton.We saw a hare racing across the meadow and then we left the river.
